slug: /172
title: "This Week In React #172: Next.js, PPR, Remotion, State of React Native, Parcel, Panda, StyleX, Cosmos, Remix, RTK, TypeScript, Skia, Reanimated, RNTL, Storybook, Flashlight, Tamagui..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 01-31-2024
---
Hi everyone!

**[@ThisWeekInReact](https://twitter.com/ThisWeekInReact)** is our brand-new X account, hit subscribe! The promise is to share and retweet interesting things happening in the React community in near-real-time, and to be as **high-signal/low-noise** as possible.

translations.fr: **[@ThisWeekInReact](https://twitter.com/ThisWeekInReact)** est notre tout nouveau compte X, abonnez-vous ! Nous nous engageons √† partager et retweeter en quasi temps r√©el des contenus int√©ressants de la communaut√© React, avec un ratio **signal/bruit maximal**.
translations.en: **[@ThisWeekInReact](https://twitter.com/ThisWeekInReact)** est notre tout nouveau compte X, abonnez-vous ! Nous nous engageons √† partager et retweeter en quasi-temps r√©el les actualit√©s int√©ressantes de la communaut√© React, avec un contenu **hautement pertinent et minimaliste**.

segments.source_content: This week React Server Components have been once-again the subject of various articles and discussions. The community has mitigated feelings about Next.js App Router. Even if people embrace the vision, they seem a little disappointed by its current implementation. Let's hope it's only temporary ü§û.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, les React Server Components ont de nouveau fait l'objet de divers articles et discussions. La communaut√© exprime des sentiments mitig√©s sur le routeur App de Next.js. Bien qu'adh√©rant √† la vision, les d√©veloppeurs semblent quelque peu d√©√ßus par son impl√©mentation actuelle. Esp√©rons que cela soit temporaire ü§û.
translations.en: Cette semaine, les React Server Components ont de nouveau fait l'objet de nombreux articles et d√©bats. La communaut√© a des sentiments mitig√©s concernant le routeur App de Next.js. Bien que la vision soit appr√©ci√©e, l'impl√©mentation actuelle semble d√©cevante pour certains. Esp√©rons que cela soit temporaire ü§û.

segments.source_content: React Native has been particularly interesting this week. The [State of React Native](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) survey results have been published, and the general feeling towards React Native is increasingly positive. There are also interesting bits related to Skia, Reanimated, or the bridgeless mode. The community is excited about Expo becoming a full-stack universal framework.

translations.fr: React Native s'est particuli√®rement d√©marqu√© cette semaine. Les r√©sultats de l'enqu√™te [State of React Native](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) ont √©t√© publi√©s, r√©v√©lant un sentiment global de plus en plus positif. Des √©l√©ments int√©ressants concernant Skia, Reanimated ou le mode "bridgeless" sont √©galement apparus. La communaut√© s'enthousiasme pour Expo devenant un framework universel full-stack.
translations.en: React Native a √©t√© particuli√®rement riche cette semaine. Les r√©sultats du sondage [State of React Native](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) ont √©t√© publi√©s, r√©v√©lant un sentiment global de plus en plus positif. On note aussi des d√©veloppements int√©ressants autour de Skia, Reanimated ou du mode bridgeless. La communaut√© se r√©jouit qu'Expo devienne un framework universel full-stack.

segments.source_content: Happy reading!

segments.source_content: üò¥ Sleep peacefully knowing that Axiom‚Äôs zero-config observability for Vercel projects has you covered.

segments.source_content:
- Use Axiom's pre-built dashboard for an overview across all your Vercel logs and vitals, drill down to specific projects and deployments, and get insight on how functions are performing with a single click.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) allows you to send logs and events from any part of your Next.js projects - client, edge, or server-side - without any special configuration.
- Easily send structured logs directly from your code and analyze them together with Vercel logs.

- Envoyez facilement des logs structur√©s depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos logs Vercel.

- Utilisez le dashboard pr√™t √† l'emploi d'Axiom pour visualiser l'ensemble de vos logs et m√©triques Vercel, explorer des projets/d√©ploiements sp√©cifiques et obtenir des insights sur les performances des fonctions en un clic.
- [next-axiom](https://github.com/axiomhq/next-axiom) permet d'envoyer logs et √©v√©nements depuis n'importe quelle partie de vos projets Next.js (client, edge ou serveur) sans configuration sp√©ciale.
- Envoyez facilement des logs structur√©s depuis votre code et analysez-les avec vos logs Vercel.

segments.source_content: Axiom efficiently captures 100% of your event data so you‚Äôll never have to worry about sampling or retention, and you‚Äôll never have to guess what your users are experiencing.

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![Next.js Explained](/emails/issues/172/ppr.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTcPrTIBkpA)
üé• [**Next.js Explained - Partial Prerendering**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MTcPrTIBkpA)
It‚Äôs is not often that a video makes the headlines here, but this one is different for a few reasons.

translations.fr: Il est rare qu'une vid√©o fasse la une ici, mais celle-ci se distingue pour plusieurs raisons.
translations.en: Il est rare qu'une vid√©o fasse la une ici, mais celle-ci se distingue pour plusieurs raisons.

segments.source_content: First the topic is super interesting and well-explained with many animated visualizations. Partial pre-rendering is a [Next.js 14 experimental feature](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-14#partial-prerendering-preview) that completes the Next.js vision and offers the best of both worlds between static and dynamic rendering. This makes Next.js a multi-paradigm framework that supports all ranges of rendering diversity. This new feature is simple to adopt, builds on top of Suspense, and doesn‚Äôt introduce new APIs: you just need to turn a flag on.

translations.fr: D'abord, le sujet est passionnant et superbement expliqu√© avec des visualisations anim√©es. Le pr√©-rendu partiel est une [fonctionnalit√© exp√©rimentale de Next.js 14](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-14#partial-prerendering-preview) qui parach√®ve la vision du framework en combinant rendu statique et dynamique. Cela fait de Next.js un framework multi-paradigme supportant toute la diversit√© des rendus. Cette nouvelle fonctionnalit√© s'adopte facilement, s'appuie sur Suspense et n'introduit pas de nouvelles APIs : activez simplement un flag.
translations.en: D'abord, son sujet est passionnant et superbement illustr√© par des animations. Le pr√©-rendu partiel est une [fonctionnalit√© exp√©rimentale de Next.js 14](https://nextjs.org/blog/next-14#partial-prerendering-preview) qui parach√®ve la vision du framework en combinant rendu statique et dynamique. Next.js devient ainsi un framework multi-paradigme supportant toute la diversit√© des techniques de rendu. Simple √† adopter, bas√© sur Suspense et sans nouvelle API : il suffit d'activer un flag.

segments.source_content: Second: this incredibly well-produced video has been created with [Remotion](https://www.remotion.dev/), using React web code üôâ. Good job Delba, you nailed it! We can‚Äôt wait to see more videos like this and to know more about your Remotion creative process. On a related note, the Remotion team just shared theirs with a [behind the scene of GitHub Unwrapped 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WW8vIZ1kwR0).

translations.fr: Deuxi√®mement : cette vid√©o incroyablement bien produite a √©t√© cr√©√©e avec [Remotion](https://www.remotion.dev/), en utilisant du code React web üôâ. Bon travail Delba, tu as tout r√©ussi ! Nous avons h√¢te de voir plus de vid√©os comme celle-ci et d'en savoir plus sur ton processus cr√©atif avec Remotion. Sur une note connexe, l'√©quipe Remotion vient de partager le sien avec un [making-of de GitHub Unwrapped 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WW8vIZ1kwR0).
translations.en: Deuxi√®mement : cette vid√©o incroyablement bien produite a √©t√© cr√©√©e avec [Remotion](https://www.remotion.dev/), en utilisant du code React web üôâ. Bravo Delba, tu as assur√© ! Nous avons h√¢te de voir plus de vid√©os comme celle-ci et d'en savoir plus sur votre processus cr√©atif Remotion. Sur une note connexe, l'√©quipe Remotion vient de partager le sien avec un [making-of de GitHub Unwrapped 2023](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WW8vIZ1kwR0).

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Accelerate your workflow with MightyMeld, a visual dev tool for React codebases. Drag, drop, click, and prompt your UI into place while you hand-code the rest of it.](https://www.mightymeld.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact5&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=1&utm_content=top)
- üëÄ [React core PR - react-server-dom-parcel package](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28138): Devon from Parcel working on a new bundler integration.
- üëÄ [Remix - support for Cloudflare through the Remix Vite plugin](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/tree/dev/templates/unstable-vite-cloudflare)
- üê¶ [Partykit - Real-time React Server Component sneak-peek](https://twitter.com/threepointone/status/1751963277394116993)
- üìú [My first impressions of Panda CSS](https://newsletter.baptiste.devessier.fr/archive/my-first-impressions-of-panda-css/): Baptiste likes Tailwind but now prefers Panda for multiple reasons, including type-safety, the ability to group styles and make them more readable, and its out-of-the-box support for styles merging and variants.
- üìú [Fix Next.js Routing to Have Full Type-Safety](https://www.flightcontrol.dev/blog/fix-nextjs-routing-to-have-full-type-safety): the Next.js typedRoute experimental feature is not good enough. We can improve routing type-safety (route params, search params, linking‚Ä¶) thanks to a route builder API.
- üìú [Migrating to Next.js App Router: the good, bad, and ugly](https://www.flightcontrol.dev/blog/nextjs-app-router-migration-the-good-bad-and-ugly): Flightcontrol rebuilt from scratch their dashboard with Next.js App Router and share feedback. There are positive experiences, but overall their team would have chosen Remix instead, and they‚Äôd prefer to use another language than using the Next.js dev server again üòÖ (note they are stuck on Next.js 13.5 and performance improved lately).
- üìú [How To Use forwardRef With Generic Components](https://www.totaltypescript.com/forwardref-with-generic-components): Matt wraps forwardRef to redefine its types and fix type inference problems.
- üìú [Updating public Next.js environment variables without rebuilds](https://phase.dev/blog/nextjs-public-runtime-variables/): the NEXT_PUBLIC env variables are inlined in the client bundles at build time. This proposes to use a find-and-replace script to update them without rebuilding.
- üìú [How to start a React Project in 2024](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-starter/): Robin discusses the tradeoffs of starting a React project with Vite, Next.js or Astro.
- üìú [Including static files in App Router RSCs](https://www.hipstersmoothie.com/blog/posts/including-static-files-with-rscs): Shows usage of advanced Webpack features such as require.context and inline loaders.
- üìú [Take a Qwik Break from React with Astro](https://thenewstack.io/take-a-qwik-break-from-react-with-astro/): Paul compares Qwik and React over various examples. ‚ÄúWrite code like React, Browser tastes of Vanilla‚Äù.
- üìú [Where do React Server Components fit in the history of web development?](https://dev.to/matfrana/where-do-react-server-components-fit-in-the-history-of-web-development-1l0f)
- üì¶ [Remix-Client-Cache - using clientLoader to cache server loader data](https://github.com/Code-Forge-Net/remix-client-cache)
- üì¶ [StyleX 0.5 - new stylex.attrs function, ESLint sort-keys rule, Babel aliases option, esbuild plugin](https://stylexjs.com/blog/v0.5.0)
- üì¶ [React Cosmos 6 - Sandbox for developing and testing UI components in isolation - RSC support, plugin system, integrations (Vite,Webpack, Next.js, RN), Lazy Mode, MDX fixtures‚Ä¶](https://github.com/react-cosmos/react-cosmos/releases/tag/v6.0.0)
- üì¶ [Panda CSS 0.29 - config validation, default values in patterns, media-quey tokens, color opacifier‚Ä¶,](https://github.com/chakra-ui/panda/discussions/2110)
- üì¶ [React-Live-Chat-Loader 2.9 - Performant live chat integration - Add support for HubSpot/Front](https://github.com/calibreapp/react-live-chat-loader/)
- üì¶ [fumadocs - powerful framework for building documentation sites in Next.js](https://github.com/fuma-nama/fumadocs)
- üì¶ [React Bricks 4.2 - RSC support](https://docs.reactbricks.com/docs/rsc/visual-components/)
- üì¶ [Redux Toolkit 2.1](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/releases/tag/v2.1.0)
- üé• [Jack Herrington - Are RSCs and NextJS Really That Bad?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u0OMdWJfdhg): compares side-by-side 3 cases where App Router has a much better DX than Page Router, and highlights how easy it is to encapsulate and distribute RSC logic inside a package.
- üé• [Nadia Makarevich - Advanced React - All about memoization in React](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=huBxeruVnAM)

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
This section is now co-authored with [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). Feel free to send us your comments by email or on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt)!

translations.fr: Cette section est d√©sormais co-√©crite avec [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). N'h√©sitez pas √† nous envoyer vos commentaires par e-mail ou sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt) !
translations.en: Cette section est d√©sormais co-√©crite avec [Benedikt](https://twitter.com/bndkt). N'h√©sitez pas √† nous envoyer vos commentaires par e-mail ou sur [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bndkt) !

segments.source_content: [![State of React Native 2023 - Survey Results](/emails/issues/172/stateofrn.jpg)](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/)
**[State of React Native 2023 - Survey Results](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/)**

I‚Äôm a big fan of all the ‚ÄúState of ‚Ä¶‚Äù surveys, because they give us a unique insight into what‚Äôs going on in the ecosystem. It‚Äôs one thing to follow the hype generated on X and elsewhere, but another thing to see stats of what developers actually use. So I‚Äôm really happy to see last year‚Äôs State of React Native results published! And as this is now the second year this survey is conducted, we can also identify some trends by comparing the results to the year before. For all the details, [have a look at the results yourself](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/)! I‚Äôll just highlight a few things that I found interesting, some of them really surprised me:

translations.fr: Je suis un grand fan de toutes les enqu√™tes "√âtat de...", car elles nous offrent un aper√ßu unique de ce qui se passe dans l'√©cosyst√®me. C'est une chose de suivre le battage m√©diatique g√©n√©r√© sur X et ailleurs, mais c'en est une autre de voir les statistiques de ce que les d√©veloppeurs utilisent r√©ellement. Je suis donc tr√®s heureux de voir publi√©s les r√©sultats de l'√âtat de React Native de l'ann√©e derni√®re ! Et comme c'est maintenant la deuxi√®me ann√©e que cette enqu√™te est men√©e, nous pouvons √©galement identifier certaines tendances en comparant les r√©sultats √† l'ann√©e pr√©c√©dente. Pour tous les d√©tails, [jetez un ≈ìil aux r√©sultats vous-m√™me](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) ! Je vais juste souligner quelques √©l√©ments que j'ai trouv√©s int√©ressants, certains m'ont vraiment surpris :
translations.en: Je suis un grand fan de toutes les enqu√™tes "√âtat de...", car elles nous donnent un aper√ßu unique de ce qui se passe dans l'√©cosyst√®me. C'est une chose de suivre le buzz g√©n√©r√© sur X et ailleurs, mais c'en est une autre de voir les statistiques de ce que les d√©veloppeurs utilisent r√©ellement. Je suis donc tr√®s heureux de voir les r√©sultats de l'√âtat de React Native de l'ann√©e derni√®re publi√©s ! Et comme c'est maintenant la deuxi√®me ann√©e que cette enqu√™te est men√©e, nous pouvons √©galement identifier certaines tendances en comparant les r√©sultats √† l'ann√©e pr√©c√©dente. Pour tous les d√©tails, [jetez un ≈ìil aux r√©sultats vous-m√™me](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) ! Je vais juste souligner quelques √©l√©ments que j'ai trouv√©s int√©ressants, certains m'ont vraiment surpris :

segments.source_content:
- State management continues to be in a very interesting state (pun intended), with Redux taking the last place in retention with only 44 % (down from 57 % last year), but still clinging to second place after React‚Äôs native capabilities in terms of usage with 78 % (down from 85 %).
- Data fetching is a category where the results are in line with the amount of attention that can be observed on social media, with TanStack Query and tRPC taking top places in terms of interest and retention, and Meta‚Äôs own Relay staying mostly irrelevant outside of Meta with only 5 % usage.
- The future of navigation is Expo Router, which exploded from 12 % usage last year to 40 % today.
- Gauging by social media activity, styling seems to be the most talked about category with an abundance of options. In terms of usage, the classics (StyleSheet API, inline styling, styled components) remain the dominant options, with NativeWind and Tamagui catching up. Tamagui managed to generate the most interest in the past year (and also has the most retention and interest as a UI component library), closely followed by a new contender: react-native-unistyles.
- Special shoutout to Expo: In the ‚ÄúReact Native tools‚Äù section, 6 out of the top 10 tools as well as the top 2 options in the deployment category are made by Expo.
- Over 85 % of respondents think that React Native is moving in the right direction and the share of developers that find that building RN apps is overly complex right now decreased from about 30 % to 25 % - that‚Äôs still too much, but we seem to be moving in the right direction!

translations.fr:
- La gestion d'√©tat reste dans une situation tr√®s int√©ressante (jeu de mots intentionnel), avec Redux en derni√®re position en r√©tention avec seulement 44 % (contre 57 % l'an dernier), mais restant solidement √† la deuxi√®me place derri√®re les capacit√©s natives de React en termes d'utilisation avec 78 % (contre 85 %).
- La r√©cup√©ration de donn√©es est une cat√©gorie o√π les r√©sultats correspondent √† l'attention observ√©e sur les r√©seaux sociaux, TanStack Query et tRPC occupant les premi√®res places en int√©r√™t et r√©tention, tandis que Relay de Meta reste largement marginal hors de Meta avec seulement 5 % d'utilisation.
- L'avenir de la navigation est Expo Router, passant de 12 % d'utilisation l'an dernier √† 40 % aujourd'hui.
- Au vu de l'activit√© sur les r√©seaux sociaux, le style semble la cat√©gorie la plus discut√©e avec une pl√©thore d'options. En utilisation, les classiques (API StyleSheet, style en ligne, composants stylis√©s) dominent toujours, tandis que NativeWind et Tamagui rattrapent leur retard. Tamagui a g√©n√©r√© le plus d'int√©r√™t cette ann√©e (et pr√©sente aussi la meilleure r√©tention et int√©r√™t comme biblioth√®que de composants UI), suivi de pr√®s par un nouveau concurrent : react-native-unistyles.
- Mention sp√©ciale pour Expo : dans la section "Outils React Native", 6 des 10 meilleurs outils ainsi que les 2 premi√®res options de d√©ploiement sont produits par Expo.
- Plus de 85 % des r√©pondants estiment que React Native √©volue dans la bonne direction, et la proportion de d√©veloppeurs trouvant la cr√©ation d'apps RN trop complexe est pass√©e d'environ 30 % √† 25 % - c'est encore trop, mais nous avan√ßons dans la bonne direction !
translations.en:
- La gestion d'√©tat continue d'√™tre dans une situation tr√®s int√©ressante (jeu de mots intentionnel), avec Redux occupant la derni√®re place en r√©tention avec seulement 44 % (contre 57 % l'an dernier), mais restant n√©anmoins √† la deuxi√®me place apr√®s les capacit√©s natives de React en termes d'utilisation avec 78 % (contre 85 %).
- La r√©cup√©ration de donn√©es est une cat√©gorie o√π les r√©sultats correspondent √† l'attention observ√©e sur les r√©seaux sociaux, TanStack Query et tRPC occupant les premi√®res places en termes d'int√©r√™t et de r√©tention, tandis que Relay de Meta reste largement marginal en dehors de Meta avec seulement 5 % d'utilisation.
- L'avenir de la navigation est Expo Router, dont l'utilisation a explos√© de 12 % l'an dernier √† 40 % aujourd'hui.
- Au vu de l'activit√© sur les r√©seaux sociaux, le stylisme semble √™tre la cat√©gorie la plus discut√©e avec une pl√©thore d'options. En termes d'utilisation, les classiques (API StyleSheet, style en ligne, composants stylis√©s) restent dominants, tandis que NativeWind et Tamagui rattrapent leur retard. Tamagui a g√©n√©r√© le plus d'int√©r√™t cette ann√©e (et affiche aussi la meilleure r√©tention et int√©r√™t comme biblioth√®que de composants UI), suivi de pr√®s par un nouveau venu : react-native-unistyles.
- Mention sp√©ciale pour Expo : dans la section "Outils React Native", 6 des 10 meilleurs outils ainsi que les 2 premi√®res options de d√©ploiement sont d√©velopp√©s par Expo.
- Plus de 85 % des r√©pondants estiment que React Native √©volue dans la bonne direction, et la part de d√©veloppeurs trouvant la cr√©ation d'apps RN trop complexe a diminu√© d'environ 30 % √† 25 % ‚Äì c'est encore trop, mais nous semblons aller dans le bon sens !

segments.source_content: Overall, really interesting results that are worth [checking out](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) in detail! Many thanks to Bart≈Çomiej, Kacper and Software Mansion for making this happen!

translations.fr: Globalement, des r√©sultats tr√®s int√©ressants √† [d√©couvrir](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) en d√©tail ! Un grand merci √† Bart≈Çomiej, Kacper et Software Mansion pour cette r√©alisation !
translations.en: Dans l'ensemble, des r√©sultats tr√®s int√©ressants qui m√©ritent d'√™tre [consult√©s](https://results.stateofreactnative.com/) en d√©tail ! Un grand merci √† Bart≈Çomiej, Kacper et Software Mansion pour avoir rendu cela possible !

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Moropo - Stop Losing Days to Detox and Build Meaningful Tests in Minutes](https://www.moropo.com?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=emails&utm_campaign=twir-20240131)
- üëÄ [React Native 0.74 PR - Make bridgeless mode the default when the New Architecture is enabled](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/pull/42714)
- üëÄ [Reanimated PR - Generators support](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/pull/5565): William Candillon feels productive writing animations with generators, and contributed this new feature to Reanimated (üê¶ [demo](https://twitter.com/wcandillon/status/1751893521907261773))
- üëÄ [Flashlight React Native performance dashboard](https://app.flashlight.dev/projects/react-native): this uses Flashlight to measure performance all React Native versions over time. For now there‚Äôs only one FlatList-based scenario.
- üê¶ [React Native visionOS - New ùöÇùöôùöäùöùùöíùöäùöï API coming soon to](https://x.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1750532404245373434?s=20)
- üìñ [Expo Docs - Using Sentry](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/using-sentry/): Using Sentry with Expo got way easier in SDK 50: Now only needs one dependency (@sentry/react-native), and doesn‚Äôt require you to configure hooks in app.json.
- üìñ [Skia Docs - new Atlas component - efficiently draw a very large number of similar textures/images](https://shopify.github.io/react-native-skia/docs/shapes/atlas/): Here‚Äôs a great üê¶ [demo](https://twitter.com/alihdjr/status/1751175731533488464) to see it in action.
- üßë‚Äçüéì [Build and Deploy React Native Apps with Expo EAS - Free Egghead course from Expo‚Äôs Kadi Kraman](https://egghead.io/courses/build-and-deploy-react-native-apps-with-expo-eas-85ab521e)
- üìú [John Gruber - Apple‚Äôs Plans for the DMA in the European Union](https://daringfireball.net/2024/01/apples_plans_for_the_dma): Apple is introducing a host of changes to the App Store in response to demands by the EU, in a way that has by many press outlets been described as ‚Äúmalicious compliance.‚Äù (also see: üìñ [Apple Developer Docs](https://developer.apple.com/support/alternative-browser-engines/))
- üìú [Recommended practices for React Native Testing Library in 2024](https://mdj.hashnode.dev/recommended-practices-for-react-native-testing-library-in-2024): RNTL author Maciej shared tips for people that might know the library but maybe haven‚Äôt kept up with the latest changes and improvements (like screen API and semantic queries).
- üìú [Communicating with React Native Web Views](https://making.close.com/posts/react-native-webviews): Using web views can be a good way to reuse parts of a web app, but those parts can also feel disconnected from the native part - this article highlights how to avoid this by establishing communication between native and web.
- üìú [Building a PhotoRoom-like background remover app with React Native and Skia](https://medium.com/@ludwighenne/building-a-photoroom-like-background-remover-app-with-react-native-and-skia-%EF%B8%8F-540743c6ec0f)
- üì¶ [React Native Storybook 7](https://github.com/storybookjs/react-native/discussions/545): After some time, RN Storybook has finally catched up to the major version of the ‚Äúparent project.‚Äù
- üì¶ [React Native 0.73.3 - Bug fixes](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.73.3)
- üì¶ [vision-camera-resize-plugin 2.0: Full rewrite to C++, much faster performance, and customizeable cropping logic](https://github.com/mrousavy/vision-camera-resize-plugin/releases/tag/v2.0.0)
- üì¶ [Tamagui 1.88 - Biggest Tamagui release, brings Expo SDK 50 support, simplifies setup via new Metro plugin](https://github.com/tamagui/tamagui/releases/tag/v1.88.0)
- üì¶ [Create Expo Stack 2.4 - Starter with Expo SDK 50, Expo Router v3, NativeWind v4, Shopify‚Äôs Restyle, and Unistyles](https://github.com/danstepanov/create-expo-stack/releases/tag/create-expo-stack%402.4.0)
- üéôÔ∏è [RNR 286 - What‚Äôs new in React Native 0.73?](https://x.com/ReactNativeRdio/status/1751015494591918434?s=20)
- üéôÔ∏è [Rocket Ship 27 - React Native‚Äôs Superpower with Theo Browne](https://share.transistor.fm/s/5b8f8a1a)
- üé• [Simon Grimm - Can this replace NextJS?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gzehQxHxtfw): Expo Router becoming an universal full-stack React framework makes it a direct competitor to Next.js.
- üé• [Theo Brown - Mobile Devs Hate Servers. Expo Wants To Fix That.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2P0q1EdH_oQ)
